meanings.definition: A method of analyzing phenomena by studying the underlying structure
meanings.sent1: In structuralism, researchers focus on the organization of things.
meanings.sent2: The study of structuralism helps us understand how things are put together.
meanings.sent3: When the structuralism of a puzzle is revealed, it all makes sense.
meanings.sent4: The structuralism of a building is like the blueprint of its design.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the structuralism of a sentence can help with grammar.

meanings.definition: A theoretical framework that emphasizes the relationships between elements in a system
meanings.sent1: The structuralism of a network shows how each part connects to the whole.
meanings.sent2: In sociology, structuralism examines how different elements interact within society.
meanings.sent3: The structuralism of a recipe is how each ingredient plays a role in the dish.
meanings.sent4: The structuralism of a story is like the threads weaving through a tapestry.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the structuralism of a game can lead to strategic thinking.
